product_a.name: GlowBoost Vitamin C Serum
product_a.how_to_use: Apply 2–3 drops in the morning before sunscreen

ingredients.analysis: Both GlowBoost Vitamin C Serum and Pure C Serum share similar key ingredients, including Vitamin C and a form of hyaluronic acid, which can help with skin hydration and brightening. However, the GlowBoost serum specifically mentions "Hyaluronic Acid" while the Pure C Serum lists "Hyaluronic", potentially indicating a difference in the type or concentration of hyaluronic acid used in each product.

benefits.analysis: Both GlowBoost Vitamin C Serum and Pure C Serum offer similar benefits of brightening the skin and fading dark spots, with the key difference being the specific wording of their effects. Ultimately, the choice between the two serums may come down to personal preference or individual skin type, as their benefits appear to be largely equivalent.

product_type.analysis: GlowBoost Vitamin C Serum offers 10% Vitamin C, while Pure C Serum provides Vitamin C Serum.

price.value_analysis: Pure C Serum is more budget-friendly.

recommendation: GlowBoost Vitamin C Serum (₹699) offers Brightening, Fades dark spots. Pure C Serum (₹499) provides Brightens skin, Fades spots. Choose based on your specific needs and budget.
